content:
The provided code chunk is part of a method responsible for drawing control points and their associated in/out tangents on an animation curve within a wxPython-based application. The code visualizes selected tangent points as circles and connects them with lines using specific colors (cyan or navy) based on their selection state, enabling interactive editing of animation curves in the graph editor window.

dc.SetPen(wx.Pen("cyan", 1))
                        dc.DrawLine(X1, Y1, X, Y)

                    if list[i][AG.IN_TANGENT][AG.SELECT] == 0:
                        X = list[i][AG.IN_TANGENT][AG.LOCAL_VALUE][0]
                        Y = list[i][AG.IN_TANGENT][AG.LOCAL_VALUE][1]
                        dc.SetPen(wx.Pen("navy", 3))
                        dc.SetBrush(wx.Brush("navy"))
                        dc.DrawCircle(X, Y, 2)

                        dc.SetPen(wx.Pen("navy", 1))
                        dc.DrawLine(X1, Y1, X, Y)

                    if list[i][AG.OUT_TANGENT][AG.SELECT] == 1:
                        X = list[i][AG.OUT_TANGENT][AG.LOCAL_VALUE][0]
                        Y = list[i][AG.OUT_TANGENT][AG.LOCAL_VALUE][1]
                        dc.SetPen(wx.Pen("cyan", 3))
                        dc.SetBrush(wx.Brush("cyan"))
                        dc.DrawCircle(X, Y, 2)
